turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Perhaps there is some good in you after all, Lex Luthor.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Me? I'm loaded with good! I mean I've never even used it.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I'll have to take the chance. Try to get them all into that molecule chamber. It takes away their powers, reduces them to human beings. Now if you could . . .

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Wait! Don't go in! It's a trap!

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Luthor, you poisonous snake . . .

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I knew you'd double-cross me, Luthor. A lying weasel like you couldn't resist the chance . . .

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Are you kidding? I knew it all the time. Did you see how they fell into our trap? Beautiful . . .

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Too late, Luthor. Too late . . .

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Listen. Have I got a proposition for you, Superman. I mean I owe you one, you know? Now don't say yes or no till you hear me out . . .

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Which one would you like to join, Luthor? Pick a hole.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute, let's talk a deal, Superman. We can take a lunch on this --

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: You said it. Three-to-one should get you 								both ears and the tail.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: He ran in fear from us . . .

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Why do you say this to me when you know I will kill you for it?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Kill me? Lex Luthor? Extinguish the greatest criminal flame of our age? Eradicate the only man on earth . . .

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: There is something more you want. The 								greed is written on your face.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Perhaps a small . . . incentive, your 									Ultimate. A tiny bauble to help me jog my memory . . .

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: What more?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Cuba.

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: No drinks . No movie. This is the last time I take a charter flight.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Where is his home, Lex Luthor? Which way?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: North. Keep going North!

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Put down Lex Luthor !

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Put down Lex Luthor?

turns.speaker: LUTHOR
turns.text: Hey, let's be fair. Actually, there've been two or three times --

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Now I shall have the Son of Jor-El as my slave! Forever. If not, the millions of earthlings you protect will pay for your defiance.  Beginning with this one.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I'm the man they're 	protecting. I'm the President. I'll kneel before you if it will save lives.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: It will. Starting with your own.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Who is this imbecile? Where is he?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I wish I knew. --  Oh, God.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Zod.  Zod.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Who is this . . . Superman?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: You'll find out, General! And when you do . . .

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Come to me, Superman! If you dare! I defy you! Come! Come, and kneel before Zod!

turns.speaker: SECOND REPORTER
turns.text: And now they are willing to release the rest of the hostages?

turns.speaker: SPOKESMAN
turns.text: In return for a guarantee that we will not launch an attack an them.

turns.speaker: SECOND REPORTER
turns.text: There will be no attack? No attempt to overpower the terrorists?

turns.speaker: SPOKESMAN
turns.text: Um. . . .we have made this guarantee.

turns.speaker: SECOND REPORTER
turns.text: Yes, but will you honor it?

turns.speaker: SPOKESMAN
turns.text: We have not the choice to refuse, have we, if we believe it is a real hydrogen bomb that they have.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Free!

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: Free!

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: Strange. I tore those metal fibers like paper. And what he did . . ..  Was amazing!  Something is happening . . ..

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Yes. To all of us. The closer we come to an atmosphere with only one sun - a yellow sun - the more our molecular density gives us unlimited powers!

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: DELETE IN CUTTING 		) There . . .  A place called . . . Houston . . .

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Then we must go there too.  To rule. Finally - to rule!  And then you shall have what you want.

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: DELETE IN CUTTING

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: And I will lead.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: So this is the planet Houston . . .

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: What shall we do now?

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Stay. I will come to you.

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: Look, they need a machine to fly.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Brave young heroes. Be nice to them, my dear. Blow them a kiss.

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: You are master of all you survey.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: And so I was yesterday. And the day before.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: This "super" man is nothing of the kind. I have discovered his weakness.

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: He...  cares. He actually cares about these . . . . . .these People. These earth People .

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: Sentimental idiot.

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: He's captured Non!

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Don't worry. I will draw his fire.  With a few of my own.

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: General --- ?

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: We must combine our strength.

turns.speaker: ZOD
turns.text: Did you really believe we would give up our advantage?

turns.speaker: URSA
turns.text: "Super-sucker . " For once, Lex Luthor was right.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: It's brilliant. Daddy thinks so, too. You'll write a new series -- 'Metropolis After Hours.'

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I really don't think . . .

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: But you're perfect for it. You're young, you're single, you're successful...

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: And I'm usually in bed by ten-thirty.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: That's just it! You don't have to flaunt it. You're no slave to fashion ... although ...

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: They make my eyes itch.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Don't worry. I won't make you do it alone. I know all the right places. I'm a member at all the right clubs . . . We'll start tonight at the grand opening of the Metro Club! It's a date!

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: You're late. Very late.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Gosh, I'm sorry, we better get in line.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Oh, Clark, you're so delightfully primitive.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I've never been in a place like this before.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: This is Metropolis after hours! This is what you'll be writing about. C'mon, let's dance.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Don't tell me. You learned to dance at church socials.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Actually, I had a crash course from my mother the night before my prom.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: My prom was so boring. We all flew to Paris the next day to recover . . . Sometimes my whole life seems boring. I thing maybe I should just give everything away and go live among the poor people. Then I remember how smashing I look in sable . . . oh, it's all so confusing. You think I'm silly, don't you?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: No ... Metropolis is a confusing place. Back in Smallville -- my hometown -- everything was more simple. People would sacrifice everything just to lend a helping hand.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: That's not what we were taught. 'Look out for number one' -- that's daddy's golden rule ... he always ends up with the gold.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh . . . no, there's no one back home.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: What about here?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Well, my career takes up a lot of my time.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Don't tell me you're waiting for lightning to strike. Wide-eyed romantics are an endangered species.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: That sounds kind of pessimistic.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: No, realistic. There's no magic in the world. Girls just don't get swept off their feet anymore.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: I feel kind of light-headed . . .

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Don't worry, I've got you.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Maybe I should sit this one out.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Don't give up. This is a perfect subject for your series on young Metropolis. Now let's get those knees up!

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Now you try, Clark. We'll start you off with 60 pounds.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: If you say so. Here goes.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: He's a jerk. I never noticed it before. Seems like a lot of people I know are jerks . . .  . . . Maybe you think the same thing about me. That's why you keep avoiding me.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I'm not avoiding you. I've been very busy and . . . I like you . . . I really do.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Then prove it. Lois is doing an interview with Superman about his peace mission . . .

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Yes, I know. I'm sure it will be a great story.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: I'll just invite them both to my hotel suite and we'll have high tea. It's very chic.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Gee, I don't think . . .

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Come early. The view is so romantic from my balcony.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Hello, Lacy. Can anybody break a twenty? The cabbie didn't have any change.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: . . . Let me get my purse.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Shouldn't you pay the cabbie?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh . . . Right. . . I'll be back in a flash.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: I missed you. It wasn't any fun up there with just Lois and Superman. They're so boring. Let's go do something wild!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: But they're expecting us. It wouldn't be polite.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh . . . my . . .

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Clark. . . !

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Hi. Is dinner ready? I'm famished.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Let's sit down. They walk to the table. LOIS calls out to the balcony.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Gee, I'm really sorry.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: No mind, it's only antique Irish linen.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Daddy's offered me jobs at some of his other companies. But, I've been thinking maybe I'll take some time off.  I'm going to find a place like Smallville, in the country. Maybe a  farm . . .  see what the slow lane is like.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I'm sorry to see you go.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: You don't have to be polite, Clark. I've got a pretty good idea of how you feel about me.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I'm not so sure you do.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Any more like you back home, Clark?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Like me?

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: You know: strong, gentle, tall men with bright blue eyes and square. Men who like to dance slow, the old fashioned way, the way their mothers taught them on the night before their prom.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You'll find a good man Lacy. You deserve one.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Maybe if you'd have met who I am now, instead of the spoiled brat you met a few weeks ago, it would have been different between us.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Lacy. . . I . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Regardez.  Voila Monsieur David Warfield.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: That tycoon who owns all those sleazy tabloids?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Au contraire, mon ami! He owns all those sleazy tabloids and the Daily Planet!

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: No Paris?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: I don't think we're being treated fairly, Lois. And I'm going to tell Miss Warfield.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Clark . . . wait!

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: The President is about to speak. I don't think it's going to be good news.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: You always overreact, Clark. How terrible can it be?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Oh, probably just a picture request. I'll take care of it if you want, Lois.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I don't think 'fan mail' fits this letter.  Read it, Clark.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: 'Are you or are you not part of a plot to weaken our national defense?'

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It's her father's grey matter that's weakened if you ask me. How can I ask Superman such a dumb question.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Politely?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: . . . Please leave your message at the beep.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Clark, it's Lois. This is the fourth message. I've left. . . Where are you ?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: It's just a bad flu, really. How did you know . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: You haven't been at work . . . you didn't call the office . . .  you didn't even call me. How could you not call back?

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Superman? Has something happened to him?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Everyone's saying he's . . . dead. But I know that isn't true. I feel it in my heart. I think he just needs help.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: You know him so well.  But I'm sure he'll manage . . . wherever he is.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It must have been a super effort to get out of bed, Clark.

turns.speaker: CLARK
turns.text: Well, I'm feeling a lot better . . . almost chipper . . .  . . . and all because I had a visit from a very good nurse.

turns.speaker: HOWLER
turns.text: Close the curtains. The sun is hurting my eyes.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Of course it is. Do you know what the sun is? Why it's just one huge nuclear bomb. A bomb with enough radiation to incinerate an average man like . . .  that.

turns.speaker: HOWLER
turns.text: But Superman isn't an average man.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: And what am I? A Shriner? No, If you'll join forces with me, together we can make the world safe for war profits again.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Boys, old Lex has a secret recipe in this dish . . . call it a genetic stew. You help me place it on one of your missiles and I promise you . . . if Superman throws it into the sun, he'll get the biggest surprise of his life. I'll be able to introduce Superman to his first nightmare . . . a Nuclear Man!

turns.speaker: HOWLER
turns.text: And this so-called . . . Nuclear Man. . . of yours can defeat Superman?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Do people die in Italian Operas? Gentlemen, if all goes to plan Nuclear Man will return from the sun with power awesome enough to do what none before him has ever been able to . . . pierce Superman's skin. He'll be mortal, he'll get sick . . . and we'll dance on his grave.

turns.speaker: HOWLER
turns.text: And what do we get out of it?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: If my plan works, gentlemen, I'll just take a tiny commission . . . something . . .appropriate. . . a number with a lot of zeros after it.

turns.speaker: HOWLER
turns.text: Lex, we all appreciate how you've supported us lately and . . . uh . . . in recognition of your hard work we've decided to increase your commission to 12 percent.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Gee guys, that's swell of you. But  . . . I've got another idea.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Impossible? Why?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Because I made a vow. Never to interfere in the destiny of your planet.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: But what good is a vow if everything gets blown away?  What good was my letter?

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I'm going to pass this letter on to all the leaders of the world. I promise you. For it is they , and not I, that represent the people of Earth.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Well, I don't understand.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Would you mind taking a walk with me?

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Absolutely!

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Would you mind waiting for me in the visitor's gallery?

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: N-no...I mean...you bet.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Awesome!

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Jeremy, I need you to tell the people of the world what you see.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: I'll try. . .

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Well . . . I see the ocean currents. . . and the rain . . . and mountains and rivers. . . but . . .

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Go on . . .

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: But you can't tell where one country begins and another ends. You can't see any borders. It's just . . . one world.

turns.speaker: SUPERMAN
turns.text: Good. If you can see it, and I can see it, maybe some day everyone will see it.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Not so fast!  All trips are canceled. We pay for wire services. And what we don't get from them, we'll invent.

turns.speaker: WARFIELD
turns.text: Mr. White, come with me I want to see

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Who does Clark Kent think he is anyway! He never even said good night!

turns.speaker: WARFIELD
turns.text: Clark Kent! You socialized with him . . . a . . . reporter!

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Oh . . . no . . . I mean, we just went  dancing . . . for  a story . . .

turns.speaker: WARFIELD
turns.text: Your grandfather had one iron rule that's stood me well. Never fraternize with the help. Keep too your own station. Am I clear?

turns.speaker: WARFIELD
turns.text: Darling, it's good riddance. Let her go. And while you're at it, fire that Clark Kent. He hasn't been here in days. He hasn't even called.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: I know Daddy. I'm worried about him.

turns.speaker: WARFIELD
turns.text: Didn't we have our little talk about personal involvement with the help? Now that you're the publisher . . .

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Daddy . . . ?

turns.speaker: WARFIELD
turns.text: Yes, darling?

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Stuff it.

turns.speaker: WARFIELD
turns.text: Tone down our headlines? Lacy, that's all the common man reads!

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: I'd just like to have a little less sensationalism.

turns.speaker: WARFIELD
turns.text: Less sensational papers go broke. I thought I taught you long ago the business of newspapers is business.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: No, Daddy. Our business is journalism. We can't continue to be so irresponsible . . . or else we'll just lead everyone into a disaster.

turns.speaker: WARFIELD
turns.text: Don't be over-dramatic, young lady. What kind of disaster could we help bring about?

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Is he for real?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: One hundred percent.  And I like him that way.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: I think he's kind of cute.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Forget it, Princess. Clark is the world's oldest boy scout  Trustworthy, loyal, obedient, helpful... and I don't remember the rest, but he's them too. And I promise, he's not interested in anyone like you.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: But all men like me, Lois. I'm very rich.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: . . . And  very na√Øve!

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: This letter was addressed to Superman care of me.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Superman gets mail here?

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: I think there's an angle.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: An angle?

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Daddy loves to whip up campaigns! People eat it up. We'll make this kid a celebrity. The whole world will be waiting for Superman's answer.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: I know I'm not exactly a Girl Scout but . . . maybe if I show him I'm trying . . . he'll like me.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Clark. He's late again.  I can't figure him out.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: That's because there's nothing to figure out. Now will you please pay attention. I'm not through insulting your father.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Lois, have you ever fallen for a guy and he's not like other guys . . . he's different. It's like you come from two different worlds.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: And your heart beats faster just thinking about him.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Right . . . you want to tell him how you feel . . .

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: But he's never there.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: Why, Lois, I didn't know . . . Who is he?

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: What's he going to say?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Something . . . wonderful.

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Our other dinner guest.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Where's Clark?

turns.speaker: LACY
turns.text: He was getting on . . . and then this man with luggage and . . .  oh, it's a long story.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: It always is with Clark.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Are we going to skip the country, Uncle Lex?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Lenny, ,you pathetic product of the public school system. Your Uncle Lex has had only one thing on his awesome mind during his incarceration . . . Destroying Superman!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Do you realize what I can create with a single strand of Superman's hair!

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: A toupee that flies?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: . . . I look at you, Lenny, and I know how the Romans felt when the barbarians arrived at their city gate.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: But why the hair?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: That hair contains a sample of Superman's genetic material. The building blocks of his body. With my genius and enough nuclear power to mutate those genes, I will create a being with all his powers . . . but with absolute allegiance to me!

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: He missed the door, Uncle Lex.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Quiet! You'll make him self-conscious.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Whoa. . .

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: He has all of Superman's powers. If I've planned it right. . .

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Gee, Uncle Lex, I don't think this guy's much of a dancer.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Let's try to keep your I.Q. a family secret, Leonard. Before we launch him against Superman, we have to test him ... see how well he does with mayhem and destruction. Kind of a coming out party under the glare of media covering the Metro Club gala. And once he proves himself, then . . .

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Superman broke your monster, Uncle Lex.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I must have miscalculated. How. . .

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Gee, Uncle Lex, I was just getting to the good part.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Get the box, nephew.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Hey, Uncle Lex, how's the Nuclear Guy goin' to find his way here?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Oh Leonard . . . When I sent the remains of my last experiment . . .

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: The one Superman wrecked up?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Not how I might have put it, but, correct. The remains I sent to the sun included the creatures genetic memory. He'll remember everything that he experienced. Not to worry. He'll find his way back to me.  Did you hear that?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You're spookin' me out, Uncle Lex.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: There!

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Hey! He looks . . . normal.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: He's . . .  beautiful. Perfect.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Hey! Just remember I made you.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You're just an experiment, freako!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: What was that about?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Didn't you see it? He lifted me up and crashed me down.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Hmm . . . Nuclear levitation. Now that's a trick that could come in handy.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: He's . . . cold. . .

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Good. Let's hope he stays that way.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Of course! That's his one vulnerability. The one way he can be stopped.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Boy, are you gonna get it.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: My nephew, Leonard. He worships me.  Let's share a toast to you . . . a nice guy who's about to finish last.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: We'll all fry.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: This wasn't in the plan.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I think he has his own plan, Uncle Lex.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Don't worry honey, I'm sure he'll make a swell husband.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Ready, Uncle Lex?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: If you need us we'll, be five hundred feet underground waiting for the Nuclear winter to turn to nuclear spring.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You think he'll find us.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Never. But we have to hide out for a  while. Lay low. Say. . . a couple of years. By then I'll have a new plan.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Lucky I brought my drums.

turns.speaker: NUCLEAR MAN
turns.text: What I need this for?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: For dignity. My reputation is at stake. Just put it on.

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I hadn't counted on this but . . .  . . . of course - the power of the sun has given him internally generated heat. I am a ...

turns.speaker: NUCLEAR MAN
turns.text: You are . . .

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: What? A genius? . . . an inspiration?

turns.speaker: NUCLEAR MAN
turns.text: You are . . . nothing. I am father now.

turns.speaker: NUCLEAR MAN
turns.text: I am an experiment? I am freako?

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: I made you, and I can destroy you.

turns.speaker: NUCLEAR MAN
turns.text: Destroy Superman!

turns.speaker: LEX
turns.text: Wait! Not yet! Back!
